metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12904 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: ** DISPUTED ** In Libgcrypt 1.8.4, the C implementation of AES is vulnerable to a flush-and-reload side-channel attack because physical addresses are available to other processes. (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.) NOTE: the vendor's position is that the issue report cannot be validated because there is no description of an attack.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> see: https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gcrypt-devel/2019-July/004760.html Upstream developers have disputed this issue, so marking as not-affected

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
